text.section:
This section does not prohibit:
picketing or assembly in connection with a labor dispute, as defined in § 4-301 of the Labor and Employment Article;
picketing in a lawful manner of a person's home when it is also the person's sole place of business; or
holding a meeting or assembly on any premises commonly used for the discussion of subjects of general public interest.
A person may not intentionally assemble with another in a manner that disrupts a person's right to tranquility in the person's home.

section.section: A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 90 days or a fine not exceeding $100 or both.
Each day on which a violation of this section occurs is a separate violation.

text.section:
In addition to the penalty provided in subsection (d) of this section, a circuit court:
may enjoin conduct proscribed by this section; and
in the proceeding for injunctive relief, may award damages, including punitive damages, against any person found guilty of violating this section.
